questions.text: A car accelerates from 10 m/s to 30 m/s in 5 seconds. Find acceleration.
questions.explanation:
Using v = u + at
30 = 10 + a(5)
20 = 5a
a = 4 m/s²

questions.text: What is the SI unit of force?
questions.explanation:
Force = mass × acceleration
Unit: kg × m/s² = Newton (N)

questions.text: A body of mass 5 kg is accelerated at 2 m/s². Find the force applied.
Kinetic energy of a body of mass 2 kg moving at 10 m/s is:
What is the value of acceleration due to gravity on Earth?
questions.explanation:
Standard value of g on Earth surface:
g = 9.8 m/s² (approximately 10 m/s²)

Power = Rate of doing work
P = Work/time = W/t
Unit: Watt (W) = J/s

questions.text: What is the escape velocity from Earth?
questions.explanation:
Escape velocity from Earth:
v_e = √(2gR) = 11.2 km/s

This is the minimum velocity needed to escape Earth's gravitational pull.

questions.text: According to Ohm's law, V = IR. What does R represent?
questions.explanation:
In V = IR:
V = Voltage (potential difference)
I = Current
R = Resistance

questions.text: Which type of radiation has the highest penetrating power?
questions.explanation:
Penetrating power:
Alpha < Beta < Gamma

Gamma rays have highest penetrating power.
- Alpha: Stopped by paper
- Beta: Stopped by aluminum
- Gamma: Needs thick lead/concrete

questions.text: Speed of light in vacuum is:
questions.explanation:
Speed of light in vacuum:
c = 3 × 10⁸ m/s
= 300,000 km/s

Mirror formula:
1/f = 1/v + 1/u

Or written as: 1/f = 1/v - 1/(-u)

Since object distance u is taken negative in sign convention.

questions.text: Which law states 'Energy cannot be created or destroyed'?
questions.explanation:
Law of Conservation of Energy:
Energy cannot be created or destroyed, only transformed from one form to another.

Total energy remains constant.

questions.text: A wave has frequency 500 Hz and wavelength 0.6 m. Find its speed.
questions.explanation:
Wave equation: v = fλ
v = 500 × 0.6
= 300 m/s

questions.text: What happens to resistance when length of wire is doubled?
questions.explanation:
Resistance: R = ρL/A

R ∝ L (if A and ρ constant)

If length is doubled, resistance is doubled.

questions.text: The audible range for human ear is:
questions.explanation:
Human audible range:
20 Hz to 20,000 Hz

- Below 20 Hz: Infrasonic
- Above 20,000 Hz: Ultrasonic

Newton's Third Law:
For every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction.

F_action = -F_reaction

questions.text: Which of the following is a vector quantity?
questions.explanation:
Vector quantities have both magnitude and direction.

Velocity is a vector.

Scalar quantities (magnitude only):
- Speed, distance, mass, time, energy
